com.sri.common.net
Interface SRISocketReader

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultSRISocketReader
public interface SRISocketReader

This is an interface used by SRISocket, which implements SRTP (Smart Robots Transfer Protocol), to return communication back to the object using the SRISocket. It defines methods for each content type capable of being read by SRTP. It also defines ability to close the socket, and authentication preferences for the reader.

Version:
1.5
Author:
Joseph Monti, Smart Robots

readText

public void readText(SRISocket socket,
                     java.lang.String text)
Called with a Content Type of "text/plain".

Parameters:
socket - The socket calling this method, used for sending data back to the socket.
text - The text which was sent.

sendAuth

public boolean sendAuth()
Determines whether or not to send authentication when sending data with the SRTP protocol.

Returns:
true if it should send authentication, false otherwise.

requiresAuth

public boolean requiresAuth()
Determines if authentication is required when sending data with the SRTP protocol.

Returns:
true if it requires authentication, false otherwise.
